Use LunaBot to track and manage your tasks easily and effectively!
The following types of tasks can be added with the commands in the format below:
eg. t buy groceries for dinner
A ToDo task will be added to you task list with the input as the description
Got it! I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list
### View all tasks in your list
Type "ls" to display all tasks currently in your list
Here are the tasks in your list:
Type mark followed by the corresponding number of the task in your list to mark it as done
YAY! I've marked this task as done! :
Type unmark followed by corresponding number of the task in your list to mark it as not done
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Type del followed by the corresponding number of the task in your list to delete it
Now you have 0 tasks in the list.
Type find followed by a keyword to find the matching tasks in your list
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
* Abstract command that is executed by LunaBot
* All specific commands inherit from this class and implement the execute method.
* @param taskList Current list of tasks to be operated on
* @param ui       User interface that handles user input and interactions
* @param storage  Storage system to save or load tasks to/from a file.
* @throws LunaBotException If an error occurs while executing the command
public abstract String execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws LunaBotException;

* Represents a Deadline task in the task list.
* A Deadline task has a description, completion status (whether it is done or not),
* and the due date of the task.
* Constructs a Deadline task with specified description, deadline and completion status.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by The deadline of the Deadline task represented as LocalDateTime.
* @param isDone Whether the Deadline task is completed or not.
public Deadline(String description, LocalDateTime by, boolean isDone) {
* Constructs a Deadline task with specified description, deadline and completion status set to not done.
* @param description The description of the Deadline task.
* @param by The deadline of the Deadline task represented as LocalDateTime.
* Converts the Deadline task into a format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representation of the Deadline task in the format to be stored in the file.
*         The format is "D | 1 or 0 (done or not done) | description | yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm (deadline)".
* Returns the string representation of the Deadline task, including its description, completion status
* @return A string representation of the Deadline task.
*         The format is "[D][X or ] description (by: MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a)".
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a");
* Represents an Event task in the task list.

* Prints a list of possible commands to the user.
Here is a list of available commands: \s
t [description] : add a ToDo task with a description \s
d [description] /by [yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm] : add a Deadline task with a due date \s
: add an event task with start and end time \s
ls : list out all tasks in your list \s
mark [number] : marks a task in your list as done \s
unmark [number] : marks a task in your list as not done \s
del [number] : delete a task from your list \s
find [keyword] : find tasks in your list with the matching keyword \s
? : help command to list all possible commands \s

ToDo completedTodo = new ToDo("read book", true);
